p:
First, we modelled the Norway rat population dynamic model based on Verhulst-Pearl logistic growth model [ 44], without consideration of SEOV infection, and identified the effect of climate on population fluctuation. Population fluctuations are regulated by an identical seasonal birth rate (b), natural mortality (m), environmental carrying capacity (K), and potential extrinsic effect ( Î¸
r ) in Eq (1). There is no significant sex difference in the Norway rat population in our study area [ 45]. To reduce the dimensionality of the model, age classes were omitted.
